data.text:
—————————————————————————————————————————————–

“ECHOED VOICES” — RECITAL TOUR WITH NICO DE VILLIERS (AUSTRALIA)

In 2022, Siobhan Stagg and pianist Nico de Villiers recorded the first disc of songs by Academy-award winning composer, Richard Hageman. The CD was praised as “Editor’s Choice” in Limelight Magazine upon its release.

In Australia, the duo presents highlights from the Hageman album alongside songs by Richard Strauss and Henri Duparc, where some of the musical parallels (“echoed voices”) are touching and sometimes uncanny.

TOUR DATES:

CANBERRA: Friday 19 July at 7PM — National Opera, Albert Hall. Click here for more info.

ADELAIDE: Sunday 21 July at 2:30PM — Ukaria Cultural Centre. Click here for tickets and more info. (SOLD OUT)

HOBART: Tuesday 23 July at 7PM — Hobart Town Hall. Click here for tickets and more info.

SYDNEY: Friday 26 July at 7PM — Sydney Opera House, Utzon Room. Click here for tickets and more info.

MILDURA: Sunday 28 July at 6PM, Mildura Arts Centre. Click here for tickets and more info.

BRISBANE: Wednesday 7 August at 7PM, Ian Hanger Recital Hall. Click here for tickets and more info.

—————————————————————————————————————————————–

RAVEL SHÉHÉRAZADE — QUEENSLAND SYMPHONY ORCHESTRA (BRISBANE, QLD)

Friday 2 August at 11:30am, Queensland Performing Arts Centre

Saturday 3 August at 7:30PM, Queensland Performing Arts Centre

Nicholas Carter conducts the QSO in a program including Helen Grime, Strauss’ Ein Heldenleben and Ravel Shéhérazade featuring Siobhan Stagg as soloist.

—————————————————————————————————————————————–

NEW: QUEENSLAND ART SONG FESTIVAL (BRISBANE, AUSTRALIA)

Wednesday 7 August at 7PM, Ian Hanger Recital Hall (Queensland Conservatorium), Brisbane.

This Brisbane concert marks the final instalment of Siobhan and Nico de Villiers’ “Echoed Voices” national recital tour after performances through July in Canberra, Sydney Opera House, Ukaria Cultural Centre (Adelaide), Mildura and Hobart. Don’t miss this beautiful program of songs by Richard Hageman, Strauss and Duparc.

—————————————————————————————————————————————–

EDINBURGH INTERNATIONAL FESTIVAL — NOZZE DI FIGARO (EDINBURGH, SCOTLAND)

10 – 18 August 2024: Edinburgh International Festival.

LE NOZZE DI FIGARO (Susanna)

Please note: this production is double cast. Siobhan is currently scheduled to play Susanna in LE NOZZE DI FIGARO on Saturday 17 August at 7PM in Usher Hall.

See Kirill Serebrennikov’s new production from the Komische Oper Berlin (2024) at the Edinburgh International Festival starring Siobhan Stagg, Peter Keller, Verity Wingate, Andrey Zhilikhosvky, Patricia Nolz and Karolina Gumos, among others. Komische Oper Berlin’s GMD James Gaffigan conducts.

Click here for tickets and more info.

Friday 23 August at 7:30PM, Esplanade Concert Hall, Singapore

Jaime Martin conducts the Melbourne Symphony and Singapore Symphony Orchestras for these special joint concerts in Singapore’s Esplanade concert hall. With Siobhan Stagg (soprano), Andrew Goodwin (tenor) and Christopher Tonkin (baritone) and combined choirs round out the team.
